analyzed: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka des rtsa ba'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa 'bum ba las snying po las snying po mchog gi rgyud gzhung gi tshad stong bdun brgya pa yang dag par bstan to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang rgyud 'di'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa ste /

translated: He abides in the nature of the place of the first abode, then in the nature of the place of the conduct of the commitments, then in the nature of the supplicant and the teacher,

original: rigs ldan mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas pho nya mo'i dngos grub dang / mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i dngos sgrub bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rigs ldan mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas pho nya mo'i dngos grub dang / mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i dngos sgrub bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mchod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: Then, one abides in the nature of the spiritual powers of the messenger and the worship. Then, one abides in the nature of the meditation of the desired powers. Then, one abides in the nature of the worship of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, by means of the bindus of bodhicitta.

original: sdig pa thams cad las nges par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnal 'byor pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig bskyang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig bral @80a * //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las nges par grol ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas rnal 'byor pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / dam tshig bskyang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / de nas dam tshig bral @80a * //
translated: Then, one abides in the nature of being definitely liberated from all misdeeds. Then, one abides in the nature of accomplishing the practitioner. Then, one abides in the nature of maintaining the pledges. Then, one abides in the nature of the separation from the pledges.

original: ba bsrung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mthe bong dang ming med dag gis zhal du zla ba'i btung ba myang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ba bsrung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo la mthe bong dang ming med dag gis zhal du zla ba'i btung ba myang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa dang /
translated: The essence of the protection of the vase, the essence of the consumption of the five nectars, the essence of the tasting of the moon drink with the thumb and ring finger in the ganacakra ma·πá·∏çala,üîΩthe essence of the union of the two organs, and then the essence of the praise of the consumption of the moon.üîΩThe sixteen aspects of the bliss of gods and humans are the supreme unchanging bliss that should be worshipped.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /

original: 'dir snyigs ma lnga'i dus na 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i yul du tshe thung zhing shes rab dman pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Here, in the time of the five degenerations, the people of Jambudvipa, especially those of the noble land, will have short lives and little wisdom.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de rnams rtsa ba'i ltung ba la 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de rnams rtsa ba'i ltung ba la 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are Vajra Masters will commit the root downfalls.

original: dge slong rnams mi dge ba bcu byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong rnams mi dge ba bcu byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: khyim na gnas pa rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: mkhas pa rnams ma thos pa'i rgyud 'chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ma thos pa'i rgyud 'chad pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The learned will explain the tantras without having heard them.

original: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud la dka' 'grel dang 'grel bshad byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rgyud la dka' 'grel dang 'grel bshad byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The learned, through their pride in their higher knowledge, will compose commentaries and subcommentaries on the tantras.

original: rgyud kyi don phyin ci log tu bstan nas dmyal bar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don phyin ci log tu bstan nas dmyal bar 'gro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taught the meaning of the tantras incorrectly, they will go to hell.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas pa rmongs pa de rnams blun pa'i dad pa nyid kyis khyim na gnas pa'i slob dpon rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur ro //

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa rnams la sun 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa rnams la sun 'byin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: slob ma gang yin pa de rnams bla ma dam pa'i skyon tshol ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob ma gang yin pa de rnams bla ma dam pa'i skyon tshol ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa bza' ba dang gnyis su med pa rnams la bstod pa dang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa bza' ba dang gnyis su med pa rnams la bstod pa dang mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not holy gurus will be praised and worshipped as if they were nondual with the deity.

original: bla ma mnyes par bya bar gsungs pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung bzhin mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma mnyes par bya bar gsungs pa sangs rgyas kyi gsung bzhin mi byed par 'gyur ro //

original: chos ston pa po rnams mi dge ba bcu la rab tu 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos ston pa po rnams mi dge ba bcu la rab tu 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: sgrub pa po rnams phyi rol gyi bza' ba dang btung ba la longs spyod pa la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnams phyi rol gyi bza' ba dang btung ba la longs spyod pa la chags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: bud med kyi 'gro ba rnams 'dod pa la shin tu brkam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med kyi 'gro ba rnams 'dod pa la shin tu brkam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud thams cad las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud thams cad las bsdus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn taught the Condensed Tantra in all the Root Tantras.

original: de yang rdo rje'i tshig mang ba nyid kyi phyir thar pa don du gnyer ba'i @83a * //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje'i tshig mang ba nyid kyi phyir thar pa don du gnyer ba'i @83a * //
translated: Moreover, because of the many vajra words,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shad dang rgyud ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa shad dang rgyud ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: the wise who seek liberation should rely on an excellent guru and understand the explanations and commentaries composed by the bodhisattvas and the statements in other tantras.

original: de'i phyir / mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mdor bsdus pa las rgyas par min //
translated: not in detail, but in brief,

original: gsang ba bdag gis bshad par bya //üîΩgsang ba zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya'i bha ga la brjod do //
analyzed: gsang ba bdag gis bshad par bya // gsang ba zhes pa drang ba'i don gyis las kyi phyag rgya'i bha ga la brjod do //
translated: I will explain the secret.

original: nges pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid do //üîΩdpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid do // dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
translated: The word secret means the bhaga of the karmamudra in the interpretable meaning, and the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom in the definitive meaning.üîΩThe phrase the union of Sri Heruka means the innate joy.

original: zhes pa la shr'i zhes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la shr'i zhes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The word sri means the innate joy.

original: he zhes pas rgyu las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'o //
analyzed: he zhes pas rgyu las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'o //
translated: The word he means the abandonment of the causal karmamudra and jnanamudra.

original: ru zhes pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //üîΩka zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i byed pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: ru zhes pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o // ka zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i byed pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The word ru means the abandonment of the characteristics of form.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The word ka means the abandonment of the functions of the eyes and so forth, which is the characteristic of non-objectifying compassion.

original: de'i yang dag sbyor zhes pa stong pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang dag sbyor zhes pa stong pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The right union of that is the oneness with emptiness, and I will explain the oneness of emptiness and compassion.

original: drang ba'i don gyis dpal he ru ka ni skyes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis dpal he ru ka ni skyes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The glorious Heruka of the interpretable meaning is the male organ,

original: de'i yang dag sbyor ba ni bud med kyi bha ga dang lhan cig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i yang dag sbyor ba ni bud med kyi bha ga dang lhan cig pa nyid de /
translated: and his right union is the oneness with the bhaga of the woman,

original: byis pa'i skye bo dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don dang / sems yul gzhan las yongs su dgrol ba'i don du ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don dang / sems yul gzhan las yongs su dgrol ba'i don du ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: and I will explain it for the sake of the merit accumulation of the childish people who desire the bliss of the two organs, and for the sake of completely liberating the mind from other objects.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa //
translated: It accomplishes all desired aims.

original: zhes pa las kyi tshig dang bdag gis bshad pa byed pa po la pa ra smee'i tshig tu thams cad rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa las kyi tshig dang bdag gis bshad pa byed pa po la pa ra smee'i tshig tu thams cad rig par bya'o //
translated: In the verbal root and verbal noun forms, all should be understood as in the present tense.

original: 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis 'dod pa'i don kun ni phra ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang sngags dang las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis 'dod pa'i don kun ni phra ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang sngags dang las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor gyis 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the meaning of all desires, which is to be interpreted externally, is the mastery of the eight mundane qualities, such as subtlety, and so on, by the yoga of mantra, action, and gnosis seals.

original: de'i sgrub byed ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab ye shes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab ye shes zhes pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the previously mentioned wisdom-knowledge.

original: nges pa'i don gyis 'dod pa kun gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis 'dod pa kun gyi rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The meaning of all desires in the definitive meaning is Vajrasattva.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: It is the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: de'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de //
analyzed: de'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de //
translated: Its meaning is omniscience,

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed pa'o //
translated: which turns the wheel of Dharma, such as the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: de'i sgrub byed ni 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed do //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed ni 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed do //
translated: The proof of that is the accomplishment of all desired goals.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying @83b rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying @83b rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion should be explained.

original: bla ma las kyang bla ma ste //
analyzed: bla ma las kyang bla ma ste //
translated: It is the guru of the guru.

original: zhes pa bla na med pa 'dod pa'i don te mi'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyi bla ma /
analyzed: zhes pa bla na med pa 'dod pa'i don te mi'i yul gyi bde ba rnams kyi bla ma /
translated: This is the unsurpassed goal, the best of human pleasures.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos grub po //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bde ba dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dngos grub po //
translated: It is the power of the eight qualities of sovereignty, etc., which is the power of the enjoyments of the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: de las kyang bla mar gyur pa ni mchog gi bla ma ste /
analyzed: de las kyang bla mar gyur pa ni mchog gi bla ma ste /
translated: And even better than that is the supreme power,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa /
translated: the bliss of omniscience, endowed with all the qualities of sovereignty.

original: tshos thams cad kyi ston pa po rnam pa thams cad pa thams cad du son pa ni bla ma las kyang bla ma ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tshos thams cad kyi ston pa po rnam pa thams cad pa thams cad du son pa ni bla ma las kyang bla ma ste zhes pa'o //
translated: The teacher of all doctrines, all-aspect, all-gone, is even better than the power.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
translated: The binding of the dakinis' network

original: zhes pa ni 'dir drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir drang ba'i don gyis mkha' 'gro ma ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /

translated: One should always worship means that at all times, whether one is clean or unclean, standing or sitting, asleep or awake, or engaged in physical, verbal, or mental activities, one should be attached to the supreme unchanging bliss, free from the joy of enjoying all external objects of desire, and unattached to the enjoyment of visible objects with the supreme senses.

original: ma'i dbugs kyi rigs ldan ma mchod pa'i cho ga /'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //

translated: Externally, the specific time of each year is the collection of the following:

analyzed: 'dir ji ltar pho nya mo rnams mchod pa de bzhin du lhan cig skyes grub rnams te /

translated: Since they are not in stages, the twenty-four heroes such as Vajrasattva grant the powers of the lower, middling, and higher [heroes] of the wheels of body, speech, and mind, which are the powers of the subterranean, terrestrial, and celestial [realms].

analyzed: de rnams kyang dus kyi khyad par gyis mchod par bya'o zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //

original: rdo rje phag mo gang yin pa de khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams su gyur nas /üîΩslar yang rang gi gnas kyi dbang gis rigs ldan ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa g-yon skor gyis 'khor ba ste zla ba'i cha la rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su dus
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo gang yin pa de khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams su gyur nas / slar yang rang gi gnas kyi dbang gis rigs ldan ma nyid du 'gyur ro zhes pa g-yon skor gyis 'khor ba ste zla ba'i cha la rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas rtogs par bya'o zhes pa dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams su dus
translated: And that which is VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ becomes KƒÅkƒÅsyƒÅ, and so on,üîΩand again by the power of her own place becomes Yamini.üîΩThis is the leftward rotation, which the yogin should understand to be the conduct of the yoginƒ´s in the lunar portion.

original: kyi khyad par gyis rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: kyi khyad par gyis rnal 'byor ma'i kun du spyod pa ste /

analyzed: nyin zhag dgu pa la rang gi gnas su bgrod pas kun du spyod pa yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: On the ninth day, by proceeding to one's own place, one practices the conduct.

analyzed: de nas mchod pa byas nas slar yang nyin zhag bcu pa la tshes gcig gi nyin zhag la ji lta ba bzhin kun du spyod do //

original: sdig pa 'char ba dang sdig pa'i phyed dang / gzhu 'char ba dang gzhu'i phyed la dbyu gu phyed dang bcas pa'i gnyis gnyis kyi rnal 'byor ma bzhi'i tshogs kyi 'khor lor kun du spyod par shes par bya'o //

translated: One should know that the four yoginis, the one who rises at dawn, the one who rises at midnight, the one who rises at dusk, and the one who rises at noon, are engaged in the ganacakra ritual in the two [directions] of the one who rises at dawn and half of the one who rises at midnight, and in the two [directions] of the one who rises at dusk and half of the one who rises at noon.

original: de nas chu srin 'char ba nas mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de nas chu srin 'char ba nas mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Then, having worshipped from the one who rises at the crocodile [direction],üîΩthe one with a hero's mind is engaged in the northwest direction.

original: dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni dbang ldan nas rlung gi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //üîΩmi'u thung ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su'o //

original: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni me'i rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni me'i rtsibs su'o //
translated: The queen of Lanka is engaged in the southeast direction.

original: shing grib ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
analyzed: shing grib ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
translated: The one in the shade of a tree is engaged in the northeast direction.

original: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni mi'u thung ma dang / mi'u thung ma ni lang ka'i dbang phyug ma dang / lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni shing grib ma dang / shing grib ma ni dpa' bo'i blo can mar 'gyur ro //

translated: Therefore, by the power of the place, the hero's wife becomes the dwarf, the dwarf becomes the lady of Lanka, the lady of Lanka becomes the tree-shaded one, and the tree-shaded one becomes the hero's wife.

original: de nas chu srin gyi phyed la snga ma'i dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //üîΩsnga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni me'i rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: de nas chu srin gyi phyed la snga ma'i dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do // snga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni me'i rtsibs su'o //
translated: Then, on the half-crocodile [square], the former hero's wife is engaged in the southwest square,üîΩthe former dwarf is in the southeast square,

original: snga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su'o //
translated: the former lady of Lanka is in the northeast square,

original: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
analyzed: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
translated: and the former tree-shaded one is engaged in the northwest square.

original: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni lang ka'i dbang phyug ma dang / mi'u thung ma ni shing grib ma dang / lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / shing grib ma ni mi'u thung mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni lang ka'i dbang phyug ma dang / mi'u thung ma ni shing grib ma dang / lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / shing grib ma ni mi'u thung mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the place, the hero's wife becomes the queen of Lanka, the dwarf woman becomes the tree-shade woman, the queen of Lanka becomes the hero's wife, and the tree-shade woman becomes the dwarf woman.

original: de nas bum pa 'char ba na /
analyzed: de nas bum pa 'char ba na /
translated: Then, when the vase arises,

original: snga ma'i dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni me'i rtsibs su kun du spyod @108a * //üîΩdo ; / snga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni me'i rtsibs su kun du spyod @108a * // do ; / snga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su'o //
translated: the former hero's wife moves to the fire spoke,üîΩthe former dwarf woman to the northeast spoke,

original: snga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su'o //
translated: the former queen of Lanka to the wind spoke,

original: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
analyzed: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //
translated: and the former tree-shade woman moves to the southwest spoke.

original: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni shing grib ma dang / mi'u thung ma ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni mi'u thung ma dang / shing grib ma ni lang ka'i dbang phyug mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni shing grib ma dang / mi'u thung ma ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni mi'u thung ma dang / shing grib ma ni lang ka'i dbang phyug mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the place, the hero's wife becomes the tree-shade woman, the dwarf woman becomes the hero's wife, the Kankali woman becomes the dwarf woman, and the tree-shade woman becomes the Kankali woman.

original: de nas bum pa'i phyed la dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do //üîΩsnga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su'o //üîΩsnga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su'o //
analyzed: de nas bum pa'i phyed la dpa' bo'i blo can ma ni dbang ldan gyi rtsibs su kun du spyod do // snga ma'i mi'u thung ma ni rlung gi rtsibs su'o // snga ma'i lang ka'i dbang phyug ma ni bden bral gyi rtsibs su'o //
translated: Then, on half of the vase, the hero's wife moves to the northeast petal,üîΩthe former dwarf woman to the northwest petal,üîΩthe former Kankali woman to the southwest petal,

original: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni me'i rtsibs su kun du spyod de /
analyzed: snga ma'i shing grib ma ni me'i rtsibs su kun du spyod de /
translated: and the former tree-shade woman to the southeast petal.

original: de'i phyir rang rang gi gnas kyi dbang gis dpa' bo'i blo can ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams rang rang gi gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes pa g-yon skor gyis 'khor ba ste chu srin 'char ba dang / chu srin gyi phyed dang /

translated: Therefore, the heroines such as the Heroine of the Self-Mastered, etc., take on their own forms by the power of their own places. This is the counterclockwise rotation, the rising of Capricorn and half of Aquarius.

original: bum pa 'char ba dang bum pa'i phyed la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa 'char ba dang bum pa'i phyed la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The heroines practice in the rising of Aquarius and half of Pisces.

original: de ltar dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye bas rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyi thugs kyi 'khor lo la kun du spyod pa tshogs kyi 'khor lor rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus sbyor phyed pa'i dbye bas rnal 'byor ma brgyad po rnams kyi thugs kyi 'khor lo la kun du spyod pa tshogs kyi 'khor lor rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogis should understand the practice in the wheel of the mind of the eight heroines by the division of the half-periods.

original: de nas mchod pa byas nas gsung gi 'khor lo la kun du spyod pa ni 'di lta ste /

translated: Then, on the full moon day, when the sun is eclipsed, one should take it out, mix it with human bone, make a pill the size of a jujube seed, and eat that pill together with one‚Äôs food and drink, etc.,

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: purified by the mantra of the four-faced one.

original: khar bcug pas kha dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khar bcug pas kha dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By placing it in the mouth, the mouth is purified.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang bsgom pa'i dus na yang thams cad bsrung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ril bu'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang bsgom pa'i dus na yang thams cad bsrung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ril bu'i cho ga'i nges pa'o /
translated: At the time of the ga·πáacakra and meditation, all will be protected.

original: // / da ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo chen po la sngar bshad pa'i g-yung mo dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi pho nya mo rnams kyi bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo chen po la sngar bshad pa'i g-yung mo dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa rigs sum cu rtsa drug gi pho nya mo rnams kyi bza' ba dang btung ba'i cho ga brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in the great ga·πáacakra, one should explain the rite of eating and drinking with the messengers of the thirty-six clans, such as the untouchable and the low-caste woman, as previously explained.

original: @115b 'dir skye bo dang bral ba'i khang ba'am shin tu sbas pa'i gnas su rigs kyi pho nya mo gos dang bral ba thams cad dang sgrub pa po nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyang phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa rang rang gi gnas su rnal 'byor
analyzed: @115b 'dir skye bo dang bral ba'i khang ba'am shin tu sbas pa'i gnas su rigs kyi pho nya mo gos dang bral ba thams cad dang sgrub pa po nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyang phyag rgya lngas rnam par brgyan pa rang rang gi gnas su rnal 'byor
translated: Here, in a house free of people or in a very hidden place, the messenger of the clan, naked and without clothes, and the twenty-four adepts, also adorned with the five symbolic ornaments, should be seated in their own places.

original: ma skra grol ba rnams dang / sgrub pa po ral pa'i cod pan bcings pa rnams mi'i pags pa'i steng du 'dug cing tshogs kyi bdag po ni 'khor lo'i dbus su ba lang dang stag gi pags pa'i steng du'o //
analyzed: ma skra grol ba rnams dang / sgrub pa po ral pa'i cod pan bcings pa rnams mi'i pags pa'i steng du 'dug cing tshogs kyi bdag po ni 'khor lo'i dbus su ba lang dang stag gi pags pa'i steng du'o //
translated: The practitioners, with their hair bound up in a topknot, sit on human skin. The lord of the ganacakra sits in the middle of the wheel on the skin of a cow and a tiger.

original: de nas mi'i pags pa khru gang tsam gyis sder byas te tshogs kyi gtso bo la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mi'i pags pa khru gang tsam gyis sder byas te tshogs kyi gtso bo la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made a footrest of human skin one cubit in size, offer it to the principal of the ganacakra.

original: shar gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la rta'i pags pa'i sder dang ; lho'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la khyi'i pags pa'i sder dang / nub kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la glang po che'i pags pa'i sder dang / byang gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang gi pags pa'i sder dang /
analyzed: shar gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la rta'i pags pa'i sder dang ; lho'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la khyi'i pags pa'i sder dang / nub kyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la glang po che'i pags pa'i sder dang / byang gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ba lang gi pags pa'i sder dang /
translated: Offer the footrest of horse skin to the yoginis of the east, the footrest of dog skin to the yoginis of the south, the footrest of elephant skin to the yoginis of the west, and the footrest of cow skin to the yoginis of the north.

original: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ma he'i pags pa'i sder dang / rlung gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la bong bu'i pags pa'i sder dang / bden bral gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ce sbyang gi pags pa'i sder dang / me'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ma he'i pags pa'i sder dang / rlung gi rnal 'byor ma rnams la bong bu'i pags pa'i sder dang / bden bral gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams la ce sbyang gi pags pa'i sder dang / me'i rnal 'byor ma rnams la rnga mo'i pags pa'i sder dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The yoginƒ´s of the wind direction should be offered a plate made of the skin of a donkey, the yoginƒ´s of the direction of Indra a plate made of the skin of an elephant, the yoginƒ´s of the direction of Agni a plate made of the skin of a buffalo, and the yoginƒ´s of the direction of Nair·πõti a plate made of the skin of a hyena.

original: de nas btung ba'i don du rang gi rigs kyi ro'i thod pa dum bu gcig pa dang dum bu gnyis pa dang dum bu gsum pa'am ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas btung ba'i don du rang gi rigs kyi ro'i thod pa dum bu gcig pa dang dum bu gnyis pa dang dum bu gsum pa'am ji ltar rnyed pa rnal 'byor ma rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of drinking, the yoginƒ´s should be offered skull-cups of their own family, either one-piece, two-piece, or three-piece, or whatever is available.

original: de nas bza' ba sder du dbul zhing btung ba padma'i snod du phul te /
analyzed: de nas bza' ba sder du dbul zhing btung ba padma'i snod du phul te /
translated: Then, having offered food on a plate and drink in a lotus vessel,

original: sgrub pa pos bskor ba gsum byas la dri dang bdug pa dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bskor ba gsum byas la dri dang bdug pa dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: the adept should circumambulate three times, make offerings of perfume, incense, flowers, and so forth, and make a request.

original: bsod nams 'di yis sems can thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di yis sems can thams cad phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes thob par gyur cig ces pa'o //
translated: By this merit, may all sentient beings attain the exalted wisdom of Mahamudra.

original: 'di la bu'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni rgyal pos bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bu'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo ni rgyal pos bya ste /
translated: Here, the circle of sons is performed by the king.

original: thun mong ba nams kyis sngags kyi stobs sam lha'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba nams kyis sngags kyi stobs sam lha'i nges pa'o //
translated: By the common [circle], [one should] recite the power of the mantra or the deity.

original: gzhan du na grub pa po rnams la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na grub pa po rnams la bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, obstacles will arise for the adepts.

original: thun mong ba'i sogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bya'o /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i sogs kyi 'khor lo ni yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis bya'o /
translated: The common circle is performed by the conventions of country and caste.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rang gi khyim du rigs kyi btsun mo yongs su smin pa dang lhan cig bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du rang gi khyim du rigs kyi btsun mo yongs su smin pa dang lhan cig bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the accumulation of merit, [one should] do it in one's own house together with the fully matured noble queen of the family.

original: gzhan du na sogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur @116a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na sogs kyi 'khor lor mi 'gyur @116a * //
translated: Otherwise, it will not be the circle of the common [circle].

original: zhing shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde bas dman zhing byang chub kyi sems myang ba spangs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde bas dman zhing byang chub kyi sems myang ba spangs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas dpa' bo'i ston mor brjod par bya'o //
translated: And it should be called the feast of the hero, with food and drink that are inferior due to the bliss of the union of wisdom and means, and devoid of the taste of the thought of awakening.

original: de nyid dge bsnyen rnams kyis slob dpon gtso bor bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dge bsnyen rnams kyis slob dpon gtso bor bya'o //
translated: Those very [laymen] are to be the chief teachers for the lay vow-holders.

original: sngags kyi tshul la slob dpon yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul la slob dpon yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In the way of Mantra, the teacher is also of three kinds:

original: khyim gnas dge tshul dge slong ni //
analyzed: khyim gnas dge tshul dge slong ni //
translated: The householder, the novice monk, and the fully ordained monk,

original: dman pa 'bring dang mchog yin no //
analyzed: dman pa 'bring dang mchog yin no //
translated: are the inferior, the middling, and the best.

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid bcu yongs su shes pa dang dbang bskur ba dang rjes su gnang ba dang ldan pa yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: And he who is endowed with the knowledge of the ten topics, the consecration, and the permission, is not the same as the other.

original: rgyud du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung las so //
analyzed: rgyud du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung las so //
translated: [The teacher] is so because of the speech of the Lord as it is taught in the tantras.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul gnyis po de dag la bla mar gyur kyang chos 'chad pa'i dus su dge slong brtul zhugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du byas te phyag 'tshal bar bya'i //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul gnyis po de dag la bla mar gyur kyang chos 'chad pa'i dus su dge slong brtul zhugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos la sogs pa mdun du byas te phyag 'tshal bar bya'i //
translated: Even though those two, the householder and the novice monk, are the gurus, when they are teaching the Dharma, the fully ordained monks who are observing the vows should pay homage to the holy Dharma, etc.,

original: chos 'chad pa ma yin par gzhan gyi dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa ma yin par gzhan gyi dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not when they are not teaching the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi dus na dam pa ma yin pa'i las dang phyag 'tshal ba spangs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dus na dam pa ma yin pa'i las dang phyag 'tshal ba spangs te /
translated: At other times, they should avoid non-holy actions and paying homage.

original: sngon du ldang ba dang gdan bstab pa la sogs pa bskur sti thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du ldang ba dang gdan bstab pa la sogs pa bskur sti thams cad bya'o //
translated: All the honors, such as rising up, offering a seat, etc., should be done first.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag sbangs nas nor la sogs pas bkur bar bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i las rkang pa bkru ba la sogs pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag sbangs nas nor la sogs pas bkur bar bya ste /
translated: Having bowed with body, speech, and mind, one should honor with wealth, etc., the non-noble actions such as washing the feet, etc.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dag la dge slong rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dag la dge slong rnams kyis zhes pa'o //
translated: The monks should do this for the householders and novices.

original: sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur te rdo rje 'dzin pa byas pa'i bla ma la ni dge slong rnams kyis dus thams cad du phyag bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur te rdo rje 'dzin pa byas pa'i bla ma la ni dge slong rnams kyis dus thams cad du phyag bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: It is certain that the monks should always bow to the guru who is a Vajra Holder, who was first a monk and later was initiated by a Vajra Master and became a Vajra Holder.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul mngon par shes pa thob pa dag la dge slong dang mi'i bdag pos kyang phyag bya'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul mngon par shes pa thob pa dag la dge slong dang mi'i bdag pos kyang phyag bya'o //
translated: The monks and the lords of men should bow to the householders and novices who have attained the superknowledges.

original: de'i phyir khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong dbang bskur ba rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim na gnas pa dang dge tshul dang dge slong dbang bskur ba rnams la rgan pa dang gzhon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bkur bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the lay practitioner, the novice, and the monk who have received higher ordination are to be honored according to their seniority.

original: 'dir khyim na gnas pa dag gis sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir khyim na gnas pa dag gis sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa'o //
translated: Here, the lay practitioner who has received higher ordination first is senior.

original: de bzhin du dge tshul dag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge tshul dag gi nang du'o //
translated: In the same way, among the novices.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag gi nang na sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa ste sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag gi nang na sngar dbang bskur ba ni rgan pa ste sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: In the same way, among the monks, the one who has received higher ordination first is senior, because of the priority of his status.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu dbang bskur ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i bu dbang bskur ba ni 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the son of a universal monarch who has received higher ordination becomes a universal monarch;

analyzed: @116b rgyal po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni rgyal bor 'gyur ro //
translated: the son of a king who has received higher ordination becomes a king;

original: blon po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni blon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blon po'i bu dbang bskur ba ni blon por 'gyur ro //
translated: the son of a minister who has received higher ordination becomes a minister.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dbang bskur ba ni slob dpon mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dbang bskur ba ni slob dpon mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the monk who has received higher ordination becomes the best master;

original: dge tshul ni slob dpon 'bring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge tshul ni slob dpon 'bring por 'gyur ro //

original: khyim na gnas pa ni slob dpon tha mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni slob dpon tha mar 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir gsum po rnams las sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje 'dzin par byas pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang rab gnas la sogs pa la tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po rnams las sngar dge slong phyis rdo rje 'dzin par byas pa ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang rab gnas la sogs pa la tshogs kyi 'dren pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is a monk first and later becomes a vajra holder is the leader of the ga·πáa in the ga·πáa cakra, consecration, and so forth.

original: de med na dge tshul te /
analyzed: de med na dge tshul te /
translated: If he is not available, then a novice monk.

original: de med na khyim na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de med na khyim na gnas pa'o //
translated: If he is not available, then one who lives in a household.

original: gang gi tsho slob dpon dge slong yod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi gtso bor mi byed na /
analyzed: gang gi tsho slob dpon dge slong yod kyang sbyin pa'i bdag pos tshogs kyi gtso bor mi byed na /
translated: If a householder master is present, but the patron does not make him the chief of the ga·πáa,

original: de ltar yon tan thams cad ldan //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan thams cad ldan //

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bde 'dod pas mi bya //

analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar rdo rje slob dpon thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa /

translated: In the center, if there is no ma·πá·∏çala of colored powder,

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rnal 'byor ma dang bral ba ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i btung bar mi 'gyur bas /

translated: In the feast of the hero, the patron should certainly offer the consort to the lord of the feast for the sake of increasing merit.

analyzed: rgan po rmongs pa ni khyim gzhan du tshim par bya'o //
translated: The elder and the fool should be satisfied in another house.

translated: In the same way, the yoginƒ´s who have been initiated in other tantras should be worshipped in their own houses at the feast of the hero.üîΩThe nuns who have previously received initiation should be in the east, according to their seniority.

analyzed: dge tshul ma dbang bskur ba rnams byang du phyogs pa'o //

analyzed: dge bsnyen ma dbang bskur ba rnams lhor mngon par phyogs par bya'o //

analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po'i g-yon du sbyin pa'i bdag pos thabs gzhag par bya'o //

translated: The remainder, such as the ma·πá·∏çala, and so on, are as before. The food and drink, and so on, are in the east.

translated: Then, beginning with the principal one of the ga·πáacakra, the food of the feast is offered in a counterclockwise direction. The drink is offered in a cup or a vessel such as a nƒÅrƒ´kela.

original: de'i phyir chang la sogs pa spyad par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba dang sbar bar bya bas bdud rtsir bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chang la sogs pa spyad par bya ba dang rtogs par bya ba dang sbar bar bya bas bdud rtsir bya ste /

translated: In this way, one should recite thirty-six hundred thousand times in one year and perform a homa of three hundred thousand and sixty thousand.

original: de nas zhal dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zhal dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the mouth becomes pure.

original: da ni kha dang rna ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni kha dang rna ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i don du rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags bzlas pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to purify the mouth, ears, etc., the recitation of the eight-line mantra is to be performed.

original: 'dir lo gnyis pa la chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khva gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas phyogs dang po la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas ba bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lo gnyis pa la chu srin gyi 'pho ba la rgya mtsho chen po'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te khva gdong ma la mchod yon phul nas phyogs dang po la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas ba bya'o //
translated: Here, in the second year, in the Makara transit, having erected the mandala on the shore of the great ocean, having offered libation to KhakharƒÅ, one should recite in the first period with a human-bone rosary.

original: gnyis pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la bong bu'i so'i bgrang phreng gis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang phreng dang / gsum pa la bong bu'i so'i bgrang phreng gis so //
translated: In the second period, with a camel-bone rosary, and in the third period, with an ass-bone rosary.

original: de ltar phyed bcas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas par bya zhing shar gyi zhal gyi las rab byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyed bcas zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bzlas par bya zhing shar gyi zhal gyi las rab byam du gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams kyis sbyin sreg khri phrag phyed dang bcas pa bzhi bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should recite four times one hundred thousand in a half-month, and perform four times fifty thousand burnt offerings with the substances taught in the eastern face section.

original: aom na mo bha ga wa te wi re sh'a ya badzra k'a k'a sye hum h'um phat ces pa rkang pa dang po'i sngags yi ge bcu dgu pa'o //

translated: The mantra of the first line is: Om, homage to the Blessed One, Virupaksa, Vajra Crow, hum hum phat! It has nineteen syllables.

original: de nas bum pa'i phyed la tshang tshing du dkyil 'khor bzhengs te /

translated: Then, in the forest on the edge of the town, one should erect the mandala.
